data.title: 37 Facts About Rupaul
data.meta_description: Delve into the fascinating world of RuPaul with these 37 mind-blowing facts about the iconic drag queen, television personality, and LGBTQ advocate.
data.text:
Reviewed by Jessica Corbett

Source: Digitalspy.com

Rupaul is an iconic figure in the entertainment industry, known for being a drag queen, model, actor, singer, and television personality. With a career spanning over three decades, Rupaul has become a cultural icon and LGBTQ+ advocate.

In this article, we will delve into 37 fascinating facts about Rupaul, exploring various aspects of their life, career, and impact on popular culture. From their humble beginnings in San Diego to their award-winning reality show “RuPaul’s Drag Race,” Rupaul has left an indelible mark on the world of entertainment.

So, get ready to sashay and read through this enlightening list of facts that will give you a deeper understanding of the remarkable journey and success of Rupaul.

Key Takeaways:

RuPaul, a drag queen and TV personality, has broken barriers in entertainment, promoting self-love and LGBTQ+ rights while leaving a glamorous mark on music, fashion, and pop culture.

RuPaul’s larger-than-life persona, mantra “You’re born naked, and the rest is drag,” and influence on drag culture have inspired countless individuals to embrace their true selves fearlessly.

Table of Contents

01RuPaul is an American drag queen, television personality, and global icon.

02RuPaul was born on November 17, 1960, in San Diego, California.

03RuPaul is the host and executive producer of the reality competition show “RuPaul’s Drag Race.”

04RuPaul became the first drag queen to be awarded a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2018.

05RuPaul has released several music albums throughout his career.

06RuPaul is known for his catchphrase, “If you can’t love yourself, how in the hell you gonna love somebody else?”

07RuPaul has appeared in numerous TV shows and movies, including “The Brady Bunch Movie” and “Broad City.”

08RuPaul identifies as gay and has been a vocal advocate for LGBTQ+ rights.

09RuPaul has published two books: “Lettin’ It All Hang Out” and “Workin’ It: RuPaul’s Guide to Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Style.”

10RuPaul has collaborated with various fashion designers and brands.

11RuPaul’s real hair is naturally curly.

12RuPaul has voiced characters in animated movies and TV shows, such as “The Simpsons” and “The Wild Thornberrys.”

13RuPaul has hosted his own talk show, “The RuPaul Show,” which aired from 1996 to 1998.

14RuPaul has won multiple Emmy Awards for his work on “RuPaul’s Drag Race.”

15RuPaul has a wax figure of himself at Madame Tussauds Hollywood.

16RuPaul has released his own line of cosmetics, including a makeup collection with Mally Beauty.

17RuPaul has been featured in music videos for artists such as Elton John, Tina Turner, and Lady Gaga.

18RuPaul is known for his extensive collection of colorful and extravagant outfits.

19RuPaul has a podcast called “What’s the Tee?” where he discusses various topics with his co-host, Michelle Visage.

20RuPaul has been a guest judge on multiple reality TV shows, including “Project Runway” and “America’s Next Top Model.”

21RuPaul has been involved in philanthropic efforts and has supported organizations such as GLAAD and the Elton John AIDS Foundation.

22RuPaul has a star on the Canada’s Walk of Fame.

23RuPaul has been open about his spiritual practices and has expressed his belief in the power of positive thinking and manifestation.

24RuPaul has inspired countless individuals to embrace their authentic selves and pursue their passions fearlessly.

25RuPaul has been featured on the cover of various magazines, including Vanity Fair and Paper.

26RuPaul has performed as a singer and has released several singles, including “Cover Girl” and “Snapshot.”

27RuPaul has a strong online presence and is active on social media platforms such as Instagram and Twitter.

28RuPaul has been honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

29RuPaul has released a fragrance collection called “Glamazon.”

30RuPaul has appeared in music videos for iconic artists such as George Michael and Paula Abdul.

31RuPaul has been a guest on numerous talk shows, including “The Late Show with David Letterman” and “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.”

32RuPaul has a mantra: “You’re born naked, and the rest is drag.”

33RuPaul’s influence extends beyond the entertainment world and has inspired drag queens around the globe.

34RuPaul has been honored with a statue at the Madame Tussauds in San Francisco.

35RuPaul has been a guest on the reality TV show “Big Brother.”

36RuPaul has his own line of eyewear called “RUPaul Frame Collection.”

37RuPaul’s drag name was inspired by a combination of his name, RuPaul Andre Charles, and the 1960s supermodel, Twiggy.

38Conclusion

39FAQs

RuPaul is an American drag queen, television personality, and global icon.

Known for his larger-than-life personality and charisma, RuPaul has become a prominent figure in the entertainment industry.

RuPaul was born on November 17, 1960, in San Diego, California.

His birth name is RuPaul Andre Charles, and he grew up in a working-class family.

RuPaul is the host and executive producer of the reality competition show “RuPaul’s Drag Race.”

The show has gained a massive following, showcasing the talent and creativity of drag queens from around the world.

RuPaul became the first drag queen to be awarded a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame in 2018.

This was a significant milestone for the drag community and a testament to RuPaul’s influence and impact on popular culture.

RuPaul has released several music albums throughout his career.

His debut album, titled “Supermodel of the World,” was released in 1993 and included the hit single “Supermodel (You Better Work).”

RuPaul is known for his catchphrase, “If you can’t love yourself, how in the hell you gonna love somebody else?”

This empowering message has resonated with fans worldwide, inspiring self-acceptance and self-love.

RuPaul has appeared in numerous TV shows and movies, including “The Brady Bunch Movie” and “Broad City.”

He has showcased his versatility as an actor, bringing his unique energy and magnetism to each role.

RuPaul identifies as gay and has been a vocal advocate for LGBTQ+ rights.

He has used his platform to raise awareness and promote equality for the LGBTQ+ community.

RuPaul has published two books: “Lettin’ It All Hang Out” and “Workin’ It: RuPaul’s Guide to Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Style.”

These books offer insights into RuPaul’s life, career, and personal journey.

RuPaul has collaborated with various fashion designers and brands.

His unique style and fashion sense have made him a fashion icon, and he has been featured in numerous magazines and fashion campaigns.

RuPaul’s real hair is naturally curly.

While he is known for his extravagant wigs, RuPaul’s natural hair adds to his versatility and ability to transform.

RuPaul has voiced characters in animated movies and TV shows, such as “The Simpsons” and “The Wild Thornberrys.”

His distinctive voice adds a touch of glamour and humor to these animated works.

RuPaul has hosted his own talk show, “The RuPaul Show,” which aired from 1996 to 1998.

The show featured celebrity interviews, musical performances, and discussions on various topics.

RuPaul has won multiple Emmy Awards for his work on “RuPaul’s Drag Race.”

The show has been recognized for its outstanding contribution to television and its impact on LGBTQ+ representation.

RuPaul has a wax figure of himself at Madame Tussauds Hollywood.

This wax replica pays homage to his influence and status in the entertainment industry.

RuPaul has released his own line of cosmetics, including a makeup collection with Mally Beauty.

His partnership with Mally Beauty allows fans to recreate his signature looks.

RuPaul has been featured in music videos for artists such as Elton John, Tina Turner, and Lady Gaga.

His captivating presence adds an extra touch of glamour to these visual works of art.

RuPaul is known for his extensive collection of colorful and extravagant outfits.

His wardrobe showcases his unique sense of style and is a reflection of his vibrant personality.

RuPaul has a podcast called “What’s the Tee?” where he discusses various topics with his co-host, Michelle Visage.

The podcast offers insights, advice, and behind-the-scenes stories from RuPaul’s life and career.

RuPaul has been a guest judge on multiple reality TV shows, including “Project Runway” and “America’s Next Top Model.”

His keen eye for fashion and his ability to provide constructive criticism have made him a sought-after judge.

RuPaul has been involved in philanthropic efforts and has supported organizations such as GLAAD and the Elton John AIDS Foundation.

He uses his platform to give back and make a positive impact in the world.

RuPaul has a star on the Canada’s Walk of Fame.

This recognition highlights his worldwide influence and popularity.

RuPaul has been open about his spiritual practices and has expressed his belief in the power of positive thinking and manifestation.

He attributes his success to his mindset and the power of visualization.

RuPaul has inspired countless individuals to embrace their authentic selves and pursue their passions fearlessly.

His message of self-love and acceptance resonates with people from all walks of life.

RuPaul has been featured on the cover of various magazines, including Vanity Fair and Paper.

These covers showcase his iconic presence and status as a pop culture phenomenon.

RuPaul has performed as a singer and has released several singles, including “Cover Girl” and “Snapshot.”

His music showcases his talent for entertaining and captivating audiences.

RuPaul has a strong online presence and is active on social media platforms such as Instagram and Twitter.

He uses these platforms to connect with fans and share glimpses of his glamorous life.

RuPaul has been honored with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

This recognition cements his status as an influential figure in the entertainment industry.

RuPaul has released a fragrance collection called “Glamazon.”

These fragrances capture the essence of RuPaul’s glamour and confidence.

RuPaul has appeared in music videos for iconic artists such as George Michael and Paula Abdul.

His collaboration with these artists further solidifies his place in music history.

RuPaul has been a guest on numerous talk shows, including “The Late Show with David Letterman” and “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon.”

His witty remarks and magnetic personality make him a favorite guest among talk show hosts.

RuPaul has a mantra: “You’re born naked, and the rest is drag.”

This mantra emphasizes the idea that we all create our own identities and personas.

RuPaul’s influence extends beyond the entertainment world and has inspired drag queens around the globe.

His legacy has transformed the drag community and brought it into the mainstream.

RuPaul has been honored with a statue at the Madame Tussauds in San Francisco.

This tribute recognizes his impact and contribution to the world of entertainment.

RuPaul has been a guest on the reality TV show “Big Brother.”

His appearance on the show added an extra dose of excitement and glamour.

RuPaul has his own line of eyewear called “RUPaul Frame Collection.”

These stylish frames allow fans to channel RuPaul’s unique sense of fashion.

RuPaul’s drag name was inspired by a combination of his name, RuPaul Andre Charles, and the 1960s supermodel, Twiggy.

This name reflects his admiration for both himself and iconic figures in the fashion industry.

Conclusion

In conclusion, Rupaul is an iconic figure in the world of entertainment and has left an indelible mark on the industry. With a career spanning decades, Rupaul has become a trailblazer for the LGBTQ+ community and has inspired countless individuals around the globe. From his groundbreaking reality TV show, “Rupaul’s Drag Race,” to his chart-topping music career, Rupaul continues to captivate audiences with his charisma, uniqueness, nerve, and talent. Whether it’s his glamorous drag persona or his empowering messages of self-love and acceptance, Rupaul’s impact cannot be overstated. As we explore the 37 facts about Rupaul, we gain a deeper understanding and appreciation for the legendary queen who continues to reign supreme in the world of drag.

FAQs

1. How did Rupaul get started in the entertainment industry?

Rupaul began his career as a musician, releasing several dance-pop albums in the 1990s. He then ventured into acting and made appearances in films and TV shows before ultimately gaining international recognition with “Rupaul’s Drag Race.”

2. How many seasons of “Rupaul’s Drag Race” are there?

As of now, there have been 13 regular seasons of “Rupaul’s Drag Race” and multiple spin-offs, including “All Stars” and international versions.

3. Has Rupaul won any awards?

Yes, Rupaul has received numerous awards throughout his career, including several Emmys for “Rupaul’s Drag Race” and a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame.

4. Is Rupaul involved in any charitable work?

Yes, Rupaul is a philanthropist and has been involved in various charitable initiatives, including supporting LGBTQ+ organizations and advocating for HIV/AIDS awareness.

5. What is Rupaul’s philosophy on self-acceptance?

Rupaul strongly believes in self-love and acceptance. His famous catchphrase, “If you can’t love yourself, how in the hell you gonna love somebody else?” serves as a reminder to prioritize self-care and embrace one’s unique qualities.

6. Has Rupaul released any books?

Yes, Rupaul has published several books, including his autobiography “Lettin’ It All Hang Out” and the motivational guide “Workin’ It! RuPaul’s Guide to Life, Liberty, and the Pursuit of Style.”

7. What impact has Rupaul had on the LGBTQ+ community?

Rupaul has been a trailblazer for the LGBTQ+ community and has played a significant role in bringing the art of drag into the mainstream. His visibility and advocacy have helped to break down barriers and promote acceptance and inclusivity.
